cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 330 miles SE of the Mouth of the Rio Grande, or 230 miles E of Tampico, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to meander over the western Gulf through the weekend and then turn northwest toward the central-upper Texas coast early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Matagorda Bay/Port O’Connor area on the central Texas coast

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Western Gulf coast from Tampico, MX northward to the upper Texas coast, including Corpus Christi to Galveston
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are possible early next week with a 15 % chance of sustained 34-kt winds and a 3 % chance of 50-kt winds at Corpus Christi.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Long-period easterly swell and onshore flow could drive surge of 2–3 ft AGL along the mid-Texas coast, possibly reaching Corpus Christi Bay at high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: Slow movement and deep tropical moisture could bring 4–8 inches of rain with locally higher totals, producing urban and low-lying flooding around the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Hazardous seas and strong currents will disrupt vessel traffic; minor coastal flooding and reduced visibility in squalls may force operational restrictions.
